N-Electron States Solver (fd_greens.main.excited_states_solver)

class ExcitedStatesSolver(h: fd_greens.qiskit_ver.main.molecular_hamiltonian.MolecularHamiltonian, ansatz_func_e: Optional[Callable[[Sequence[float]], qiskit.circuit.quantumcircuit.QuantumCircuit]] = None, ansatz_func_h: Optional[Callable[[Sequence[float]], qiskit.circuit.quantumcircuit.QuantumCircuit]] = None, q_instance: Optional[qiskit.utils.quantum_instance.QuantumInstance] = None, apply_tomography: bool = False, h5fname: str = 'lih')[source]

Bases: object

A class to calculate and store information of excited states.

Initializes a EHStatesSolver object.

Parameters

  • h – The molecular Hamiltonian.

  • ansatz_func_e – The ansatz function for N+1 electron states.

  • ansatz_func_h – The ansatz function for N-1 electron states.

  • q_instance – The QuantumInstance object for N+/-1 electron state calculation.

  • apply_tomography – Whether tomography of the states is applied.

  • h5fname – The HDF5 file name.

save_data()[source]

Saves N-electron excited-state energies and states to hdf5 file.

run(method: str = 'exact') → None[source]

Runs the excited state calculation.

Parameters

method – The method to calculate the excited states. Either exact (‘exact’) or VQE (‘vqe’).
